meanings.definition: One who carries out the execution of a condemned person.
meanings.sent1: The executioner led the prisoner to the gallows.
meanings.sent2: The executioner's job is to carry out the death sentence.
meanings.sent3: The executioner's precision in his work was both feared and respected.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the queen acts as the executioner, taking out the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent5: The executioner's black hood added an ominous touch to the scene.

meanings.definition: A person who carries out a task or duty with precision and efficiency.
meanings.sent1: As the team leader, she was the executioner of project deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The chef was the executioner of perfectly cooked steaks in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to be the executioner of repetitive tasks in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The accountant acted as the executioner of financial discrepancies, ensuring accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher became the executioner of spelling mistakes, correcting each one with care.
